Interface_name: TCP Server - side based on node.js net
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a TCP server class that intercepts Redis traffic, capable of operating in different modes (capture, test, or forward), with functionality to save, mock, or forward data between client and Redis server.

Class Description: RedisInterceptor is a class that creates a TCP server to intercept Redis protocol traffic. It can operate in three modes: capture (save request/response pairs), test (respond with mocked data), or forward (pass through traffic unchanged). The class handles client connections, data forwarding, and response processing.

Attributes:
- Pythagora: [Object] - Reference to the parent Pythagora object for saving captured data
- listenPort: [Number] - Port number on which the interceptor listens for client connections
- targetPort: [Number] - Port number of the target Redis server (default: 6379)
- intermediateData: [Array] - Array containing mocked request/response pairs for test mode
- listenSocket: [Object] - Reference to the net.Server instance
- targetSocket: [Object] - Reference to the net.Socket connection to Redis
- mode: [String] - Current operation mode ('capture', 'test', or undefined for forward)

Methods:
- constructor(Pythagora, listenPort, targetPort, intermediateData) -> [RedisInterceptor] - Initializes the interceptor with configuration parameters
- init() -> [Promise] - Asynchronously creates and starts the TCP server, resolving when listening
- forwardData(connection, data, saveData) -> [undefined] - Forwards data to Redis server and handles response, optionally saving it
- splitIntoChunks(str, chunkSize) -> [Array] - Helper method to split strings into chunks of specified size

Note: The class assumes the existence of constants MODES (for operation modes) and CHUNK_SIZE (for response chunking) which should be defined elsewhere in the code.
